subject: JUnit-addons and ComparabilityTestCase - how to run test case class?
msgSnippet: Hello Guys, I am a JUnit-newbie and I would like to test compareTo() for an object from my domain-model. I found a helper class called ComparabilityTestCase in
messageBody:
Hello Guys,

I am a JUnit-newbie and I would like to test compareTo() for an object from
my domain-model.

I found a helper class called ComparabilityTestCase in JUnit-addons (
http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net/) to reuse the logics to test the
method.

So I created a subclass of ComparabilityTestCase to return the proper
objects (for lessInstance, equalInstance, greaterInstance).
But when I run this test case class (in Eclipse IDE using JUnit4, I think),
I ge the following failures like:

What is the problem here? Shall I use also the JUnit-addons testrunner, as
well?
Thanks in advance!

BitBlockCompareToTest
com.contiautomotive.ertools.eeprom.eeprompostprocessor.model.layout.BitBlockCompareToTest
testForReverseSigns(com.contiautomotive.ertools.eeprom.eeprompostprocessor.model.layout.BitBlockCompareToTest)
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 1st equal not equal to 2nd
expected:<com.contiautomotive.ertools.eeprom.eeprompostprocessor.model.layout.BitBlock@1abc7b9>
but
was:<com.contiautomotive.ertools.eeprom.eeprompostprocessor.model.layout.BitBlock@c55e36>
